xml.bio: Mollie Brewer is a Ph.D. student in Human-Centered Computing at UF, working on the AI-Powered Athletics Project in close collaboration with the University Athletics Association. She holds a B.S. in Exercise and Sport Science and an M.S in Applied Physiology and Kinesiology, bringing a strong sports science background with computer science research. Mollie’s research explores how athletes and coaching staff engage with technology in their daily routines, with the goal of guiding technology to better meet their needs and foster understanding and trust in the data they use. Alongside her academic work, Mollie stays connected to the world of professional cycling, working with the U.S. national team and maintaining ongoing involvement in initiatives that support growth and opportunity in women’s professional cycling.
